messages.content: What is the optimal voltage to use for lipids when using Advion Triversa Nanomate nanoESI?

The optimal voltage to use for lipids when using Advion Triversa Nanomate nanoESI is approximately +1.2 kV. This voltage is used for ion spray when infusing lipid samples. This information was found in the document titled 'Nanomate/1-s2.0-S1570023209001342-main.pdf', on page 2.
After using our Advion Triversa Nanomate nanoESI system, we determined that the optimal conditions for lipidomics experiments are a spray voltage of +1.35 kV and a gas pressure (psi) of 0.2.
Thank you for sharing your findings. It's valuable to have real-world data.

CustomActionLogSummaryMemory.buffer: The optimal voltage to use for lipids when using Advion Triversa Nanomate nanoESI is approximately +1.2 kV. This voltage is used for ion spray when infusing lipid samples with the TriVersa NanoMate system. The ion spray voltage of +1.2 kV is recommended for lipidomics experiments with the Advion Triversa Nanomate nanoESI system. The source of this information is "Nanomate/1-s2.0-S1570023209001342-main.pdf", page 2. After using our Advion Triversa Nanomate nanoESI system, we determined that the optimal conditions for lipidomics experiments are a spray voltage of +1.35 kV and a gas pressure (psi) of 0.2.

It referred to the document "Nanomate/1-s2.0-S1570023209001342-main.pdf" on page 2 to obtain this information. In a new conversation, the AI did not provide any response to the human's statement about determining optimal conditions for lipidomics experiments with a spray voltage of +1.35 kV and a gas pressure of 0.2 psi.
